translation: 大方等大集日藏經十卷(或十二卷或十五卷題云大乘大方等日藏分經與大集日密分同本當第四出開皇四年五月起翻五年二月訖沙門智鉉費長房等筆受)大雲輪請雨經二卷(開皇五年正月出沙門慧獻筆受是大雲經第六十四品第二出與周世闍那耶舍大雲請雨經及隨崛多方等請雨經並同本)大莊嚴法門經二卷(一名文殊師利神通力經亦名勝金色光明德女經開皇三年正月出第三譯與法護大淨法門經等同本沙門智鉉筆受)德護長者經二卷(一名尸利崛多長者經開皇三年六月出沙門僧琨筆受第四譯與法護月光童子經等同本)百佛名經一卷(開皇二年十二月出沙門慧獻筆受第二出)力莊嚴三昧經三卷(開皇五年十月出費長房筆受)蓮華面經二卷(開皇四年三月出沙門慧獻筆受)堅固女經一卷(開皇二年十二月出沙門慧獻筆受亦云牢固女上八部並見長房錄)右八部二十三卷其本並在。
The ascetic Nālandī Rīyesa.
That's a Sui term for a venerable.
He was from Udyāna in northern India.
He was first appointed director of Zhaoxuan in Qi.

source_sentence: 共昭玄都沙門法智譯經七部。
translation: Together with Zhaoxuandu Shaman Fazhi, they translated seven sūtras.
They are listed in the Qi records.
In the season of Jiandec, Zhou Wu overthrew Qi.
Buddhism and the state were pacified at one time.

source_sentence: 耶舍外假俗服內襲三衣。
translation: Yeshe assumed the secular robe outside and the three robes inside.
He took refuge in the east and west and had no time to rest.
The five groups of people were embarrassed by their debilitation and had no place to go to for shelter.
Those who were frugal and hungry in the gutter had their food reduced and given to them.
Those who are elderly and sick and support their strengths are given aid according to their conditions.
Even though his work is meager, he refuses to heed advice and practices it.
Instead, he had a strong mind and a strong heart, and he taught and guided without tire.
It took four years for him to bear the burden of hardship.
The Sui royal court revived the Three Treasures.
At the beginning of Kaihuang, the Brahmacārī Sutra was a distant response.
I sent down a seal to invite him to come and translate it.
In the seventh month of the second year, his disciples Daomi and others.
They were escorted to the capital to stay at Daxingshansi.
In the winter of that year, they created a new business in the grass.

source_sentence: 勅昭玄統沙門曇延等三十餘人令對翻傳。
translation: I instructed Zhaoxuan Tongsa, the ascetic Tanyan, and more than thirty others to pair up and translate it.

source_sentence: 主上禮問殷繁供奉隆渥。
translation: The lord paid him great respect and offered him generous support.
Although he was quite old, his practice was diligent.

source_sentence: 曾依舍利弗陀羅尼具依修業。
translation: He had relied on Śāriputra's dhāraṇī for complete reliance and cultivation of his practice.
He attained the objective realm in a dream and will become a buddha himself.

source_sentence: 如此靈祥雜沓其例非一。
translation: Such a mixed bag of spiritual blessings was not an isolated case.

source_sentence: 後移住廣濟寺(煬帝名廣改為弘濟今復避諱為崇濟焉)為外國僧主。
translation: Later, he moved to Guangji Temple (Emperor Yang's name was changed from Guang to Hongji, but now he avoids the name Chongji) and became the head of the foreign order.
He kept his visitors in check and subtly captured the minds of all living things.
Suddenly, he once told his disciples.
"I'm going to die soon because I'm old and my strength is weak.
Now, I've clearly understood and admonished your disciples.
"It's appropriate to diligently cultivate the Buddha's teachings, for they are difficult to come by.
Be careful not to pass away in vain when the human body is difficult to obtain.
After he finished speaking, he went to rest and passed away.
He was a hundred years old.

source_sentence: 即開皇九年八月二十九日。
translation: It was the twenty-ninth day of the eighth month in the ninth year of Kaihuang's reign.
At the beginning, Yeshe first met a man with good characteristics who said.
"He will surely reach 100 years old and will also reach immortality.
His words were true when the fruit of his middle life ended.
It's still difficult to fathom the mysterious principle of ascending to immortality.
However, his appearance was exquisite.
His head is like a tuft of flesh, and his ears are long and pert.
His ears are long and perked up.
His eyes are correctly placed in the middle.
He has extraordinary features that are especially special.
He was certainly a great virtuous man who transmitted the Dharma.
After the Dharma lord tilts his head and sympathizes with the people of the Way, he'll gradually fall into disuse.
The matter of promoting prosperity will gradually fall into disuse.
During the Sui dynasty, eight scriptures were translated.

source_sentence: 即大集日藏大雲輪大莊嚴法門等經是也。
translation: These were the Sun-Store, the Sun-Store, the Cloud-Wheel, the Dharma Gate, and other scriptures.

source_sentence: 並沙門僧琛明芬給事李道寶學士曇皮等。
translation: They were also translated by the ascetic Sengchen Mingfen, who served as minister to Li Daobao and Bianta Dhampi.
The four saṃgha and secular members of the order further transmitted the words of the scriptures.

source_sentence: 沙門智鉉道邃慧獻僧琨奉朝請庾質學士費長房等筆受。
translation: The ascetic Zhihyuan Daosui Huixian Sengkun was invited by the imperial court to receive the scriptures at the request of Yu Qi and the bachelor Fei Changfang.

source_sentence: 昭玄統沙門曇延昭玄都大興善寺主靈藏等。
translation: Zhaoxuan Tongsa Sengyan Zhaoxuandu Daxingshansi lord Lingzang and others.
There were more than twenty guardians of virtue, beginning and end.
In the winter of the fifth year, he had completed all the investigations.
He also prepared a preface written by the ascetic Yanzong.
He had traveled around for forty years in search of Yesha.
There were more than fifty countries.
There were 150,000 miles.

source_sentence: 瑞景靈迹勝寺高僧駛水深林山神海獸無非奉敬。
translation: Ruijing Lingwu Jixingsi and senior monks sailed through the deep forests, mountains, gods, and sea creatures, all of whom were honored.

source_sentence: 並預懲降事既廣周未遑陳敘。
translation: He also preventively punished those who had surrendered for an extensive career that he hadn't had time to recount.
The ascetic Yan Cong wrote the original biography of the temple.
